intro: Mabea angustifolia var. major, commonly known as the narrowleaf mabea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
